values: Thanksgiving: It was a good year. There were new friends made New things learnt. New realisation of old things. And going into only the second month of 2015 has seen us receive many reminders of who we are and what we are called to do. Lead us, Guide us. We will try and make ourselves available. We will try and fit into the huge puzzle that only You can make. www.ywam.org.sg
http://mandrake-dreams.livejournal.com/2896.html

Just attended IDMC 2014. It was a truly blessed time and I truly gained a lot from it. Chiefly, a renewed sense of urgency and a need to actualise the things that I've always had simmering at the back of my head. Schedulise to actualise. So I guess I must make it a point to really put it inside my calendar so that I may allocate time to it. Time which, if not rationed properly, would be squandered away by the many inane activities that I do.

And so another clash begins for the hearts and minds of the Sheeple. What separates bigotry from making a stand? What separates asserting rights and imposing of ideology? When do freedoms become restrictions? And when does silence no longer suffice for tolerance? What is society other than an organised collection of minorities with similarities comprising thus the majority?
http://mandrake-dreams.livejournal.com/2482.html

So I wonder how relationships can be mended when there's an elephant in the room?

Posted via LiveJournal app for Android.
http://mandrake-dreams.livejournal.com/2247.html

It's a strange situation when all that is valued in this world are the things that inflict poverty on the soul.

 

Is good design worthless here on this red dot?

 

How often do we have to cater to the pragmatist's statement that "it has no monetary value and therefore we will not execute the design as proposed"?

 

It seems to me that in our society now the things that cannot be quantified, e.g. Music, Literature, Art, Design amongst other things, are relegated to the background precisely because a value cannot be objectively attached to them.

 

I really wonder if we need to attach some arbitrary dollar value to such things that enrich the soul and make the heart sing?

 

The economic progress that has been made in this society has vastly outstripped the spiritual development of its people. We are a First World country with a Third World spirit.

 

Why else would there be calls for graciousness? For compassion? For such intangibles that make us Human?

 

We have become automatons that respond only to digital inputs; soulless vessels marching to the tune of what the somatic compels us to do?

 

How does one price integrity, honesty or perseverance?

It looks back as it falls, reflecting the pale cerulean whilst capturing the world in a perfect little sphere, bouncing all the light around it so that we see miracles.
http://mandrake-dreams.livejournal.com/1763.html

I met a traveller from an antique land Who said: Two vast and trunkless legs of stone Stand in the desert. Near them, on the sand, Half sunk, a shattered visage lies, whose frown, And wrinkled lip, and sneer of cold command, Tell that its sculptor well those passions read Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things, The hand that mocked them and the heart that fed: And on the pedestal these words appear: "My name is Ozymandias, king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!" Nothing beside remains. Round the decay Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare The lone and level sands stretch far away.
                                      --Percy Bysshe Shelley

There was a forest of "T", And if one day they were all cut down,  A messy "Tangle" would bend at an "angle" and "Tracking" would stick to the wall and be some boring "racking" A fearsome tiger would be a muddlesome iger and a ride on the Train would become a wet adventure in the rain.

So I'm moving on, and this represents the beginning of a new chapter. 

Perhaps with more time I would be able to ramble on more, and hopefully keep the journal entries as a log and memoir. 

A silent shout in cyberspace, public and yet lost in the sea of voices. 

yea...a new beginning
